repositories.brief_summary: Standard library enhancements with new Option and Dynarray functions, Domain API refinement, and substantial test infrastructure improvements
repositories.new_features_summary: New Option.for_all/exists functions, Dynarray.rev_iter/rev_iteri, Domain.count API, and enhanced test infrastructure with relocatable OCaml support
repositories.new_features:
- **Option module enhancements** with new `for_all` and `exists` functions that behave like their List counterparts on zero or one element ([#13920](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13920))
- **Dynarray reverse iteration** support with `rev_iter` and `rev_iteri` functions for stack-like workflows, iterating from highest to lowest index ([#12877](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12877))
- **Domain API refinement** by renaming `Domain.running_domain_count` to `Domain.count` for cleaner interface ([#14096](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14096))
- **Improved Unix/Sys symmetry** with shared implementations between `Sys` and `Unix` modules for portability functions like rename, close, chdir, and system commands ([#13447](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13447))
- **Enhanced test harness infrastructure** for relocatable OCaml with comprehensive testing tools for bytecode binaries, dynlink, link modes, relocation, and toplevel functionality ([#14014](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14014))
- **TSan test reliability improvements** through better synchronization and de-instrumentation of string/bytes initializing writes ([#14059](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14059))
- **Sanitizer debug support** with proper debugger flags for native-debugger tests when running with sanitizers ([#14085](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14085))
- **OCamldoc formatting fix** removing unwanted paragraph tags in module tables for cleaner documentation output ([#14098](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14098))
- **Pattern matching determinism** fix addressing non-deterministic code generation in certain pattern matching scenarios ([#14091](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14091))

group_summaries.brief_summary: Standard library enhancements with new Option and Dynarray functions, Domain API refinement, and substantial test infrastructure improvements
group_summaries.new_features_summary: New Option.for_all/exists functions, Dynarray.rev_iter/rev_iteri, Domain.count API, and enhanced test infrastructure with relocatable OCaml support
group_summaries.new_features:

- **Domain API refinement** by renaming `Domain.running_domain_count` to `Domain.count` for cleaner interface ([ocaml/ocaml#14096](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14096))
- **Improved Unix/Sys symmetry** with shared implementations between `Sys` and `Unix` modules for portability functions like rename, close, chdir, and system commands ([ocaml/ocaml#13447](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13447))
- **Enhanced test harness infrastructure** for relocatable OCaml with comprehensive testing tools for bytecode binaries, dynlink, link modes, relocation, and toplevel functionality ([ocaml/ocaml#14014](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14014))

- **API consistency improvements** with Domain module cleanup and enhanced Unix/Sys module symmetry for better cross-platform compatibility ([ocaml/ocaml#14096](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14096), [ocaml/ocaml#13447](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13447))

- **Standard library expansion** delivered through [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) adding `Option.for_all` and `exists` predicates ([ocaml/ocaml#13920](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13920)) plus `Dynarray.rev_iter` and `rev_iteri` for reverse iteration ([ocaml/ocaml#12877](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12877))
- **Domain module API cleanup** by [Nicolás Ojeda Bär](https://github.com/nojb) renaming `running_domain_count` to the cleaner `Domain.count` function ([ocaml/ocaml#14096](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14096), [ocaml/ocaml#14086](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14086))
- **Cross-platform compatibility improvements** through [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) symmetrizing shared functions between `Sys` and `Unix` modules for better code maintainability ([ocaml/ocaml#13447](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13447))
- **Testing infrastructure overhaul** by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) implementing comprehensive test harness for relocatable OCaml with tools covering bytecode, dynlink, link modes, and relocation scenarios ([ocaml/ocaml#14014](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14014))
- **ThreadSanitizer reliability** enhanced by [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) fixing flaky tests through better synchronization and de-instrumenting string/bytes writes ([ocaml/ocaml#14059](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14059))
- **Documentation and tooling refinements** including [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) fixing OCamldoc paragraph formatting ([ocaml/ocaml#14098](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14098)), [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) adding sanitizer debug flags ([ocaml/ocaml#14085](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14085)), and [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) addressing pattern matching determinism ([ocaml/ocaml#14091](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14091))
group_summaries.notable_discussions:
- **ThreadSanitizer crash investigation** with [Nathan Taylor](https://github.com/dijkstracula) reporting crashes in both Semgrep and dune builds under TSan, leading to [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) identifying potential C stub compilation issues with Dune ([ocaml/ocaml#14083](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14083))
- **Pattern matching determinism** discussion where [Cristiano Calcagno](https://github.com/cristianoc) discovered non-deterministic code generation in pattern matching compilation, resolved through [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) implementing deterministic hash table iteration ([ocaml/ocaml#14088](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14088))
- **Type scope error messages** debate with [Jim Fehrle](https://github.com/jfehrle) requesting clearer explanations for "type constructor would escape its scope" errors, with [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) providing detailed scope visualization proposals ([ocaml/ocaml#14095](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14095))
- **Digest reproducibility concerns** raised by [Stéphane Glondu](https://github.com/glondu) about compression causing binary distribution issues when zstd versions change, affecting cmi/cmx digests ([ocaml/ocaml#14089](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14089))
group_summaries.emerging_trends:
- **Standard library ergonomics** emphasis with consistent addition of missing predicates and iteration functions to match established patterns across modules
- **Test infrastructure maturation** through comprehensive test harness development covering complex scenarios like relocatable installations and cross-platform compatibility
- **ThreadSanitizer integration** becoming more robust with systematic fixes for flaky tests and proper toolchain integration
- **Developer experience focus** evident in pattern matching determinism fixes, clearer error messages, and improved documentation formatting
- **Platform consistency** efforts through code sharing between Unix and Sys modules, reducing maintenance burden and potential discrepancies
